key_insight: HiStream makes high-resolution video generation practical by eliminating redundant computation across space and time: denoise at low resolution then refine at high resolution while streaming and caching intermediate features to avoid recomputation.
problem_solved: It addresses the quadratic compute and memory bottleneck of diffusion-based high-resolution video generation that makes inference prohibitively slow and resource-intensive.
method: Spatial compression: perform core denoising at low resolution, then refine to high resolution using cached high‑res feature maps to avoid full high‑res passes.
Temporal compression: generate video in streaming chunks and reuse cached temporal context/feature representations across adjacent chunks to eliminate redundant frame-level computation.
Autoregressive, redundancy‑eliminated pipeline: combine the above with lightweight refinement stages and feature caching to reduce overall FLOPs and memory during inference.
impact: Enables much more efficient, scalable high-resolution video synthesis—making practical real-time or large-scale inference for digital media and film pipelines while lowering hardware costs and latency for ML practitioners.
